interlinear-text.item: ELA How It feels to sing Bilbilik

phrase.item: From Navovod [village], where [you can find] the 'Bibi Fotima' hot spring.
In 2011 I got married here [in Murghab].
It's been 8 years of marriage and I have been living here [the whole time].
I used to sing 'Bilbilik' when I went to the pasture in the mountains in Wakhan. I used to sing this with my grandmother.
When my grandmother and I used to graze the lambs and goats, we would sing [on the way].
You feel different when you sing Bilbilik, you feel sadder.
And when you sing it, it makes you sad.
It is usually about missing your homeland, and about parents, as it is written here, so it's all about mothers and homelands.
Since we got married and came here, to a strange place,
